page.title: 07Ghostly Footsteps
page.content: The grounds of Wallsend Hall are now a public park.The area to the north of the row of poplar trees was originally the market garden of the Hall.When it became a park this was used by the Council as a area to rear bedding plants.Many of the garden workers reported hearing strange noises over the years which nobody could account for.Descriptions of this noise tell of a woman's footstep with a trailing dress going over a gravel path.When they looked up nothing could be seen. The path through this garden led from the village pump to a row of miners' cottages.The outhouses of the market garden have recently been demolished and the area grassed over.No reports of the mysterious footsteps have been made in the past five years.
